summary.en: “preidea” is not standard English; it’s usually meant to mean a preliminary or early idea.
summary.zh: “preidea”不是标准英文词；通常想表达“初步/早期想法”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) A preliminary or early idea; an idea you have before you fully develop a plan or final concept.
definition.zh: （非标准用法）初步想法；在计划或最终概念成形之前的早期念头。

examples.en: At this stage it’s just a preidea, not a complete proposal yet.
examples.zh: 现阶段这只是个初步想法，还不是完整提案。

examples.en: Share your preidea with the team so we can build on it.
examples.zh: 把你的初步想法分享给团队，我们可以在此基础上完善。

extraExplanation: “preidea”不是常见或标准英文单词，更多时候可能是把“pre-idea（初步想法）”连写了，或想表达“preliminary idea / early idea / rough idea”。
前缀“pre-”表示“在……之前”（before），如：prewar（战前的）、pretest（预测/预先测试）。如果你是在正式写作中使用，建议改写为“preliminary idea”或“initial idea”。
如果你能提供一句原文语境，我可以帮你判断更自然、地道的表达。

summary.en: Preidentification means identifying (or assigning an ID to) someone or something ahead of time.
summary.zh: preidentification 指在事前对人或事物进行识别，或提前分配用于识别的编号/标识。

definition.en: the act or process of identifying someone or something in advance (before a later event, procedure, or official confirmation).
definition.zh: （在后续事件、程序或正式确认之前）预先识别、预先确认的行为或过程。

examples.en: Preidentification of participants helped the research team schedule interviews efficiently.
examples.zh: 对参与者进行预先识别帮助研究团队高效安排了访谈。

examples.en: The hospital requires preidentification of patients before certain tests can be performed.
examples.zh: 医院要求在进行某些检查之前先对患者进行预先确认身份。

definition.en: a preliminary label or identification code assigned ahead of time, often for tracking or organization.
definition.zh: （常用于追踪或管理的）预先分配的标识、编号或标签。

examples.en: Each sample received a preidentification number before it was sent to the lab.
examples.zh: 每个样本在送往实验室之前都被分配了一个预先编号。

examples.en: Use the preidentification tag to match the package to the correct order.
examples.zh: 用预先标识标签把包裹与正确的订单对应起来。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“identification”表示“识别/身份确认”。合在一起多见于正式或技术语境（如研究、医疗、物流、信息管理）。日常英语里更常说“identify in advance / pre-identify / prior identification”。
拼写上有时也会写成带连字符的形式“pre-identification”，在学术或正式写作中更常见。

summary.en: Preidentified means already identified beforehand, often in formal or technical contexts.
summary.zh: preidentified 指“事先已识别/已确认的”，常见于较正式或技术性语境。

definition.en: Already identified in advance; recognized before something officially happens or before closer checking is needed.
definition.zh: 预先确认的；事先识别出来的（在正式发生或进一步核查前就已确定）。

examples.en: Only preidentified guests were allowed into the event.
examples.zh: 只有预先确认的宾客才被允许进入活动现场。

examples.en: The system flags preidentified risks so the team can respond faster.
examples.zh: 系统会标记预先识别的风险，以便团队更快应对。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是常见前缀，表示“在……之前/预先”。“preidentified”多用于正式或技术语境（如安保、合规、数据处理、医疗筛查），强调“提前完成识别/确认”而不是临时发现。
在日常口语里，人们更常说“already identified”“identified beforehand”或“known in advance”。

summary.en: Preidentify means to identify something or someone ahead of time.
summary.zh: preidentify 指“提前识别/预先确认”某人或某事。

definition.en: to identify someone or something in advance (before an event, process, or official check)
definition.zh: 预先识别；提前确认（在某事件、流程或正式核查之前）

examples.en: The airline asked passengers to preidentify their luggage using a tag.
examples.zh: 航空公司要求乘客用行李牌预先识别自己的行李。

examples.en: Researchers preidentified the main themes they would look for in the interviews.
examples.zh: 研究人员预先确定了他们将在访谈中寻找的主要主题。

extraExplanation: “preidentify”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ identify 组成，常见于较正式或技术性的语境，如安检/合规流程（提前核验身份或风险对象）、研究方法（预先界定变量、主题、样本）等。日常口语里更常用 “identify in advance / identify beforehand”。

summary.en: “Preidentifying” means identifying something in advance, or describing info used to do that.
summary.zh: “preidentifying”指“预先识别/提前确认”，也可形容“用于预先识别的信息或步骤”。

definition.en: identifying someone or something in advance (before an event, process, or official step happens).
definition.zh: 预先识别；在某个事件、流程或正式步骤发生之前先确定身份或特征。

examples.en: The team is preidentifying high-risk patients so they can receive faster care.
examples.zh: 团队正在预先识别高风险患者，以便他们能更快得到照护。

examples.en: We’re preidentifying key issues before the meeting.
examples.zh: 我们在会议前预先识别关键问题。

definition.en: describing information or work used to identify in advance.
definition.zh: （作定语）用于预先识别的；提前确认身份/信息的。

examples.en: The form includes preidentifying questions such as your date of birth.
examples.zh: 这张表格包含一些用于预先识别的问题，例如你的出生日期。

examples.en: Preidentifying details can help prevent errors later.
examples.zh: 预先识别的细节可以帮助减少后续错误。

extraExplanation: “preidentifying”常见于较正式的语境（医疗、数据处理、安全、研究等），来自动词“pre-identify（预先识别）”的现在分词形式。
拼写上常见两种：preidentifying（不加连字符）与 pre-identifying（更清楚、也更常见于正式写作）。在需要强调前缀pre-时，用连字符更易读。

summary.en: “Preignant” is a rare, old spelling of “pregnant,” and can also mean “full of meaning” in literary use.
summary.zh: “preignant”是“pregnant（怀孕的）”的罕见旧拼写；在文学用法中也可指“意味深长、富有暗示”。

definition.en: (Archaic/rare spelling) pregnant; expecting a baby.
definition.zh: （古体/罕见拼写）怀孕的；有身孕的。

examples.en: In older texts, you may see “preignant” used for “pregnant.”
examples.zh: 在较早的文本里，你可能会看到用“preignant”来表示“pregnant（怀孕的）”。

examples.en: She was said to be preignant with her first child.
examples.zh: 据说她怀着第一个孩子。

definition.en: (Figurative, literary) full of meaning, suggestion, or potential; rich and significant.
definition.zh: （比喻/文学用法）意味深长的；富有暗示或潜力的；含义丰富的。

examples.en: There was a preignant pause before he answered.
examples.zh: 他回答前有一阵意味深长的停顿。

examples.en: The novel is preignant with images of loss and hope.
examples.zh: 这部小说充满了关于失去与希望的意象。

extraExplanation: “preignant”多见于中古或早期英文作品，是“pregnant”的旧拼写形式。现代英语几乎只用“pregnant”。
比喻义（“充满意味/暗示”）在正式写作中仍可见，但更常用的现代替代词包括“meaningful, suggestive, significant”。

summary.en: Preignition is early ignition—especially in an engine—where the fuel-air mixture ignites before the correct timing.
summary.zh: Preignition 指“预点火”，尤指发动机里混合气在正确点火时机之前过早燃烧。

definition.en: (In an internal combustion engine) the fuel–air mixture ignites too early, before the spark plug fires (or before the correct timing), which can cause knocking and engine damage.
definition.zh: （在内燃机中）燃油与空气的混合气过早点火，在火花塞点火之前（或早于正确点火时机）燃烧，可能导致爆震并伤害发动机。

examples.en: Preignition can quickly damage pistons if the engine is under heavy load.
examples.zh: 在高负载下，预点火可能会迅速损坏活塞。

examples.en: High temperatures in the combustion chamber increase the risk of preignition.
examples.zh: 燃烧室温度过高会增加预点火的风险。

examples.en: The mechanic checked the spark plugs and fuel quality to prevent preignition.
examples.zh: 技师检查了火花塞和燃油品质，以预防预点火。

definition.en: The act or process of igniting something earlier than intended (a less common, more general use).
definition.zh: （较少见、较一般的用法）比预期更早点燃的行为或过程。

examples.en: In safety tests, any preignition is treated as a serious hazard.
examples.zh: 在安全测试中，任何预点火都会被视为严重危险。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，+ “ignition”（点火/燃烧开始）。在汽车语境里，preignition 常与 “engine knock / knocking（敲缸/爆震）”一起出现，但两者不完全相同：预点火是“点火时机过早”的原因之一，而爆震更强调燃烧过程异常导致的敲击声与压力冲击。
常见的相关表达：prevent preignition（预防预点火）、preignition event（预点火事件）、spark plug heat range（火花塞热值，过热可能提高预点火风险）。

summary.en: “preilium” isn’t a standard English word. It may be a misspelling of “prelim/preliminary” or the Latin “proelium” (“battle”).
summary.zh: “preilium”不是标准英文单词，可能是“prelim/preliminary（初步的/预赛）”的误拼，或拉丁语“proelium（战斗）”。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; likely a misspelling or a Latin-derived form.
definition.zh: 不是标准英文单词；很可能是拼写错误或拉丁语相关形式。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “preilium” in an English dictionary—did you mean “prelim” or “preliminary”?
examples.zh: 我在英文词典里找不到“preilium”——你是不是想写“prelim”或“preliminary”？

examples.en: If you saw it in a Latin text, it may be a misspelling of “proelium,” meaning “battle.”
examples.zh: 如果你是在拉丁文里看到的，它可能是“proelium（战斗）”的误拼。

extraExplanation:
“preilium”在现代英语中基本不使用，也不是常见拼写。最接近的可能有两类：
1) 英语缩写：prelim（口语/书面缩写，来自 preliminary，表示“初步的；预赛/初试”）。
2) 拉丁语：proelium（意为“战斗/交战”，英语中很少直接用，更多用于古典研究或文学语境）。
如果你能提供出现它的句子或出处（例如书名/截图/上下文），我可以更准确判断你要找的词。

summary.en: Preilluminate means to illuminate something in advance, usually in technical contexts.
summary.zh: preilluminate 指“预先照明”，多用于技术语境。

definition.en: to illuminate something in advance; to light it before the main action or exposure (often used in optics/photography or technical writing)
definition.zh: 预先照明；在主要操作或曝光之前先照亮（常见于光学/摄影等技术语境）

examples.en: In some imaging tests, the sensor is preilluminated to reduce noise.
examples.zh: 在一些成像测试中，会先对传感器进行预先照明以降低噪声。

examples.en: The sample was preilluminated for ten seconds before measurement.
examples.zh: 在测量前，样品先被预先照明了十秒。

extraExplanation: 这是一个比较少见、偏技术的词，结构是 pre-（“预先”）+ illuminate（“照亮”）。在普通日常英语里更常用 light beforehand / illuminate beforehand，或在科研写作里用 pre-expose（预曝光）等更具体的术语。

summary.en: Preillumination means light given beforehand—either as preparatory stage lighting or as a prior light exposure in imaging/optics.
summary.zh: preillumination 指“预先的照明/预照射”，可用于舞台的预备灯光，也可指成像/光学中的预曝光。

definition.en: Light provided before an activity or a main lighting change; in theater/film, a low, preparatory light on stage or set before the scene begins.
definition.zh: 在某个活动开始前提供的照明；在戏剧/影视中，指场景开始前舞台或布景上的低亮度预备灯光。

examples.en: The director asked for soft preillumination so the audience could settle in before the first scene.
examples.zh: 导演要求使用柔和的预备灯光，让观众在第一幕开始前先安静下来。

examples.en: Technicians tested the preillumination to make sure the props were visible during setup.
examples.zh: 技术人员测试预备照明，以确保布景准备时道具清晰可见。

definition.en: In photography/optics, exposure of a sensor or material to a small amount of light beforehand to influence its response (e.g., reduce sudden contrast or change sensitivity).
definition.zh: 在摄影/光学中，指先给予感光材料或传感器少量光照，以影响其反应（例如降低突变对比或改变灵敏度）。

examples.en: The engineer used preillumination to stabilize the sensor’s readings in low light.
examples.zh: 工程师用预照明来稳定传感器在弱光下的读数。

examples.en: A brief preillumination can sometimes reduce harsh shadows in certain imaging setups.
examples.zh: 在某些成像设置中，短暂的预照明有时能减轻过硬的阴影。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ illumination（“照明/照射”）构成，属于较少见、偏技术或舞台/影视行话的用词。日常英语更常说 “pre-lighting”（预打光）或 “initial lighting”（初始照明）。
拼写上有时也会看到连字符形式 “pre-illumination”，含义相同。

summary.en: A rare verb meaning to illustrate or explain something beforehand.
summary.zh: 一个罕见动词，表示“在事前用图示或例子先行说明”。

definition.en: (Rare) To illustrate something in advance; to provide explanatory pictures or examples beforehand.
definition.zh: （罕见）预先说明；在事情发生前用图示、例子等先行阐明。

examples.en: The teacher preillustrated the concept with a simple diagram before the experiment.
examples.zh: 老师在实验前先用一个简单的示意图预先讲解这个概念。

examples.en: The manual preillustrates key steps so users know what to expect.
examples.zh: 说明书预先用图示展示关键步骤，让用户知道会发生什么。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里非常少见，通常更自然的说法是："illustrate in advance"、"explain beforehand"、"provide a preview"，或用名词形式 "pre-illustration"（在特定出版/排版语境里偶尔见）。
构词上是前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ illustrate（“说明；用图示/例子阐释”）。写作中如果担心读者不认识，建议改用更常见表达。

summary.en: “Preillustrated” means already illustrated in advance (rare; often written as “pre-illustrated”).
summary.zh: “preillustrated”指“预先配有插图的”（较罕见，常写作“pre-illustrated”）。

definition.en: (rare) Illustrated in advance or already provided with illustrations; having pictures added beforehand.
definition.zh: （罕用）预先配有插图的；事先已经配图的。

examples.en: The teacher handed out preillustrated worksheets so students could focus on labeling the parts.
examples.zh: 老师发了预先配有插图的练习纸，这样学生可以专注于标注各部分。

examples.en: The manual comes preillustrated with step-by-step diagrams.
examples.zh: 这本说明书预先配好了分步骤的示意图。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 pre-（“在……之前、预先”）+ illustrated（“有插图的”）构成，但在日常英语里不算常见。更自然的说法通常是 “already illustrated / with illustrations included / pre-illustrated（带连字符）”。写作时如果要用，建议用连字符 pre-illustrated，更符合常见拼写习惯。

summary.en: “Preillustrating” means illustrating or explaining something in advance, often with examples or visuals before the main content.
summary.zh: “Preillustrating”指在主要内容之前，先用例子或图示提前说明、铺垫。

definition.en: (Present participle/gerund of preillustrate) explaining or showing something with images, examples, or details in advance (before the main text, talk, or event).
definition.zh: （preillustrate 的现在分词/动名词）在正文、演讲或事件之前，提前用图片、例子或细节来说明、展示。

examples.en: The designer is preillustrating the key steps so readers won’t feel lost later.
examples.zh: 设计师正在提前用图示说明关键步骤，这样读者后面就不会迷失。

examples.en: Preillustrating the concept with a simple diagram can make the lesson much easier.
examples.zh: 先用一个简单的图表预先说明概念，会让课程更容易理解。

extraExplanation: “preillustrate / preillustrating”比较少见，更多时候英语会用更自然的表达：“illustrating beforehand / previewing with examples / giving an illustrative preview / setting the scene with examples”。
常见使用场景：教材、说明书、演示文稿（PPT）在进入主体内容前，先用图例或示例做“预先示范/铺垫”。

summary.en: “Preillustration” means a preliminary or preview illustration made before the final artwork (rare/nonstandard).
summary.zh: “preillustration”指在最终作品之前制作的预先插图/示意图（较少见、非规范常用词）。

definition.en: a preliminary illustration made before the final version, used to plan, explain, or preview an idea (not a common standard word; often written as “pre-illustration”).
definition.zh: 预先绘制的插图；在最终版本之前制作的示意图/预览图，用来规划、说明或提前呈现想法（并非常见规范词，常写作“pre-illustration”）。

examples.en: The designer prepared a pre-illustration to show the client the layout.
examples.zh: 设计师先做了一张预先插图，让客户了解版面布局。

examples.en: Her pre-illustrations were simple sketches that guided the final artwork.
examples.zh: 她的预先插图是简单草图，用来指导最终成稿。

examples.en: We used a pre-illustration in the proposal to make the concept clearer.
examples.zh: 我们在提案中放了一张预先插图，让概念更清楚。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ illustration（“插图/图示”）构成，但在英语里并不算常用固定词。更自然的表达通常是 preliminary illustration、concept sketch、rough draft、mock-up，或直接说 a preview illustration。写作时如果担心读者不熟悉，建议改用这些更常见的说法。

summary.en: A preimage is the set of inputs that map to a specified output (or set of outputs) under a function; also, more rarely, a predecessor or forerunner.
summary.zh: preimage 指函数下映射到某个输出（或输出集合）的输入集合（原像/逆像）；较少见时也可指某事物的前身或先导。

definition.en: (Math) For a function or mapping, the set of all input values that are mapped to a given output value or set; the inverse image.
definition.zh: （数学）在函数/映射中，被映射到某个输出值或某个输出集合的所有输入值所组成的集合；逆像（原像）。

examples.en: If f(x)=x², the preimage of 4 is {−2, 2}.
examples.zh: 如果 f(x)=x²，那么 4 的原像是 {−2, 2}。

examples.en: The preimage of the interval [0,1] under f is the set of all x such that f(x) is between 0 and 1.
examples.zh: 在 f 下，[0,1] 的原像是所有满足 f(x) 介于 0 和 1 之间的 x 的集合。

definition.en: (General/technical) Something that exists earlier and is seen as a forerunner or predecessor of a later thing (rare outside academic writing).
definition.zh: （一般/学术用法）后来事物的前身、先导、前兆（较少见，多用于学术写作）。

examples.en: Some historians describe early community schools as a preimage of the modern public education system.
examples.zh: 一些历史学者把早期的社区学校描述为现代公共教育体系的前身。

extraExplanation: “preimage”在数学里最常见，常写作 preimage of A under f，记作 f⁻¹(A)。这里的 f⁻¹ 不一定表示“反函数”，而是表示“逆像运算”：f⁻¹(A) = {x | f(x) ∈ A}。即使 f 没有反函数（例如不是一一对应），preimage 仍然总是定义良好。
相关领域：集合论与拓扑学中常用“preimage”。例如在拓扑里，连续性的等价表述之一是：对任意开集 U，f⁻¹(U) 也是开集。
词形：pre-（在前）+ image（像/映像）。因此中文常译“原像/逆像”，与“image”（像/值域中的对应结果）相对。

summary.en: Preimaginary is a rare/nonstandard adjective meaning “before being imagined,” sometimes used loosely in technical contexts but not a common standard term.
summary.zh: preimaginary 是罕见且不太标准的形容词，通常表示“在被想象之前”；偶尔被松散地用于技术语境，但并不常见。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) Existing or occurring before something is imagined; before it takes shape as a mental image or idea.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）在被想象之前就存在的；在形成心理图像或想法之前发生的。

examples.en: The artist spoke of a preimaginary feeling—something sensed before any clear picture appeared.
examples.zh: 那位艺术家谈到一种“前想象”的感觉——在任何清晰画面出现之前先被感知到的东西。

examples.en: In her journal, she tried to describe the preimaginary stage of a dream, when emotions come first and images follow.
examples.zh: 在日记里，她试着描述梦的“前想象阶段”：情绪先来，画面随后才出现。

definition.en: (Technical, very rare) Related to a value or object that would map to an imaginary value under a function; a “before-mapping” counterpart of something imaginary.
definition.zh: （技术用法，极罕见）与某函数映射后会得到虚数的值/对象有关；可理解为某个“虚数结果”的映射之前的对应物。

examples.en: In a few notes, the author calls such inputs “preimaginary,” because the output lies on the imaginary axis.
examples.zh: 在一些笔记里，作者把这类输入称作“preimaginary”，因为输出落在虚轴上。

extraExplanation: “preimaginary”并不是常见词，也不算标准词典词条。写作中更常见的表达包括：**before being imagined**（在被想象之前）、**pre-imagined**（预先设想的）、或用更清晰的名词短语来改写。
如果你想表达“函数的原像（preimage）”概念，数学里更标准的词是 **preimage**（原像/逆像），而不是 preimaginary。
拼写上也常见带连字符的形式 **pre-imaginary**，用于强调“pre-（在…之前）+ imaginary（想象的/虚构的）”的构词关系。

summary.en: “Preimagination” means imagining something ahead of time—creating an expectation before it happens.
summary.zh: “preimagination”指“预先想象/提前在脑中预演”，即事情发生前先形成预期。

definition.en: The act of imagining something in advance; forming a mental picture or expectation before something happens.
definition.zh: 预先想象；在事情发生之前先在脑中形成画面或预期。

examples.en: Her preimagination of the trip made the long workweek feel shorter.
examples.zh: 她对旅行的预先想象，让漫长的工作周感觉没那么难熬。

examples.en: Try to notice when preimagination turns into worry rather than planning.
examples.zh: 试着觉察：当预先想象从“规划”变成“担忧”时，你的心态可能已经变了。

extraExplanation: “preimagination”在现代英语里不算常见用词，写作中更常见的形式是带连字符的“pre-imagination”，或直接用更自然的词：anticipation（期待/预期）、mental rehearsal（心理预演）、preconception（先入之见，偏“成见”）。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ imagination（想象）。因为拼写不常见，正式写作里建议改用更常用的替代表达，以免读者觉得生造或拼写错误。

summary.en: To imagine something beforehand (rare).
summary.zh: 提前想象/预想某事（较罕见）。

definition.en: (Rare) To imagine or picture something in your mind before it happens or before you have direct experience of it.
definition.zh: （罕见）在事情发生之前，或在没有亲身经历之前，先在脑海中想象/设想某事。

examples.en: Before moving abroad, she tried to preimagine what daily life would be like.
examples.zh: 在出国之前，她试着先想象一下日常生活会是什么样子。

examples.en: It’s hard to preimagine how a new city feels until you actually walk its streets.
examples.zh: 在真正走上新城市的街道之前，很难预先想象那种感觉。

extraExplanation: “preimagine”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ imagine 组成，意思直观，但在现代英语里非常少见。更常用、也更自然的表达是：imagine in advance / anticipate / picture / envision（提前想象、预想）。
语体提示：在正式写作中，用 “anticipate” 或 “envision” 往往更地道；“preimagine”更像是创造性写法（偶见于文学、评论或个人写作）用来强调“在发生之前就开始构建想象”。

summary.en: Preimagined means imagined or conceptually planned in advance.
summary.zh: preimagined 指“预先想象的 / 提前构思好的”。

definition.en: Imagined or pictured in your mind beforehand (before something happens or is created).
definition.zh: 预先想象的；事先在脑海中设想的（在事情发生或作品完成之前）。

examples.en: The director entered the studio with a preimagined ending already in mind.
examples.zh: 导演走进片场时，脑海里已经有一个预先设想好的结局。

examples.en: Their preimagined plan didn’t match the reality on the ground.
examples.zh: 他们预先想象的计划与现场实际情况不一致。

definition.en: Planned as a concept in advance, especially in art, design, or storytelling.
definition.zh: （尤指艺术、设计或叙事中）提前构思好的；预先设定为概念的。

examples.en: The game’s world feels richly preimagined, with detailed maps and history.
examples.zh: 这个游戏的世界观像是被充分提前构思过的，有详细的地图和历史。

examples.en: She used a preimagined color palette to keep the brand consistent.
examples.zh: 她使用预先构思好的配色方案来保持品牌一致性。

extraExplanation: “preimagined”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ imagined 组成，属于较少见的用法；写作中也常见拼作 “pre-imagined”（加连字符）来强调构词结构。
它与更常见的 “reimagined”（重新想象/改编）不同：preimagined 强调“事先想好”，reimagined 强调“后来改写或重新构思”。

summary.en: Preimagining means imagining or forming a vision of something ahead of time.
summary.zh: preimagining 指在事情发生或开始创作之前进行预先想象与构想。

definition.en: the act of imagining something in advance, before it happens or before it is created; thinking ahead creatively
definition.zh: 事先想象；在事情发生或创作之前先在脑中构想

examples.en: Good planning starts with preimagining possible problems.
examples.zh: 好的规划从预先想象可能出现的问题开始。

examples.en: The author’s preimagining of the ending helped shape the whole story.
examples.zh: 作者对结局的预先构想塑造了整部故事。

definition.en: a particular vision or mental picture formed ahead of time (often used in creative work or design)
definition.zh: 预先形成的设想／构想（常用于创意、设计等语境）

examples.en: Her preimagining of the city was greener and more walkable.
examples.zh: 她对这座城市的预想更绿色、更适合步行。

examples.en: We shared our preimagining of the product before building a prototype.
examples.zh: 在做原型之前，我们先分享了对产品的预想。

extraExplanation: “preimagining”多见于较偏创意或学术的语境，强调“在现实行动之前先做想象/设想”，常接 of（preimagining of…）。在日常英语中，人们也常用更常见的表达替代，比如：imagine ahead of time, envision beforehand, anticipate, plan out。

summary.en: Preimbibe means to drink beforehand (or, more generally, to absorb something in advance). It’s rare and often used humorously.
summary.zh: preimbibe 指“事先喝（酒）/提前喝一杯”，也可引申为“预先吸收（信息等）”。该词较罕见，常带幽默或俏皮语气。

definition.en: (rare) To drink (especially alcohol) beforehand; to have a drink in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见）事先饮用（尤指酒）；提前喝一杯。

examples.en: We preimbibed at home to save money before going to the concert.
examples.zh: 我们在家先喝了点儿，去音乐会前省点钱。

examples.en: He suggested we preimbibe so we wouldn’t spend so much at the bar.
examples.zh: 他建议我们先喝一点，这样在酒吧就不会花太多钱。

definition.en: (rare, figurative) To absorb or take in beforehand (ideas, information, influences).
definition.zh: （罕见，引申）预先吸收；提前摄取（思想、信息或影响）。

examples.en: She preimbibed the key concepts by skimming the chapter before class.
examples.zh: 她上课前先略读章节，提前吸收了关键概念。

examples.en: Children often preimbibe attitudes from the adults around them.
examples.zh: 孩子常常会从身边的大人那里提前“吸收”一些态度。

extraExplanation: 词形结构：pre-（“在……之前”）+ imbibe（“饮用；吸收”）。因此字面意思就是“在之前先喝/先吸收”。
用法提示：preimbibe 非常少见，多见于幽默、半正式或自造词的语境；日常更常说 have a drink beforehand / pregame（口语）/ drink in advance。
文化语境：在美式口语里，pregame 常指“活动前先喝几杯”（如去派对、球赛前），语气更自然；preimbibe 更像书面或俏皮的说法。

summary.en: Preimbibed means already drunk or absorbed beforehand (rare, formal).
summary.zh: preimbibed 指“事先喝下或吸收的”（较罕见、偏书面）。

definition.en: already drunk in or absorbed beforehand; taken in earlier than a particular time or event
definition.zh: 事先喝下或吸收的；在某个时间或事件之前就已摄入的

examples.en: By the time the tasting began, he was already preimbibed with strong coffee.
examples.zh: 品鉴开始时，他已经事先喝了浓咖啡。

examples.en: The sponge seemed preimbibed with water, so it couldn’t soak up much more.
examples.zh: 这块海绵看起来已经预先吸满了水，所以吸不了太多了。

definition.en: past form of “preimbibe”: to drink or absorb something beforehand (rare)
definition.zh: “preimbibe”的过去式：预先饮入/吸收（较罕见）

examples.en: She preimbibed the solution before the procedure, as instructed.
examples.zh: 按指示，她在操作前预先饮用了该溶液。

extraExplanation: “preimbibed”非常少见，多见于较书面或技术性的语境。它由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ imbibe（“饮入；吸收”）构成，所以字面意思就是“先吸收/先喝下”。日常英语里更常用的表达是 “already absorbed,” “pre-soaked,” 或 “had already drunk/consumed … beforehand”。

summary.en: Preimbibing means drinking alcohol before an event (humorous), or more literally soaking/absorbing liquid in advance (rare).
summary.zh: preimbibing 指（多为幽默说法）活动前先喝酒；或（较少见）字面上的提前吸水/浸泡。

definition.en: (informal, often humorous) Drinking alcohol before an event, meal, or outing; “pre-drinking.”
definition.zh: （非正式，常带幽默）在参加活动、吃饭或外出前先喝酒；相当于“预饮/先喝一轮”。

examples.en: They were preimbibing at home before going to the concert.
examples.zh: 他们去音乐会前在家先喝了几杯。

examples.en: Some people preimbibe to save money on expensive bar drinks.
examples.zh: 有些人先喝酒是为了省下酒吧里很贵的酒钱。

examples.en: We decided not to preimbibe because we had an early meeting the next day.
examples.zh: 我们决定不先喝，因为第二天一早有会议。

definition.en: (rare, literal) Soaking up liquid beforehand; absorbing in advance.
definition.zh: （较少见，字面）事先吸收/浸吸液体；提前浸泡。

examples.en: Preimbibing the sponge helps it clean more effectively.
examples.zh: 先把海绵浸湿会更好清洁。

examples.en: The seeds were preimbibing in water to prepare for germination.
examples.zh: 种子先在水中吸水浸泡，为发芽做准备。

extraExplanation: “preimbibing”来自“pre-（事先）+ imbibe（吸收；喝酒）”。在现代口语里最常见的是第一种意思，语气偏俏皮，常用于派对或聚会语境。
更常见、更自然的说法是：pre-drink / pregame / pre-gaming（英式英语也常说 pre-drinks）。在正式写作中通常不建议用 preimbibing。
使用提醒：涉及饮酒话题时注意场合与文化差异；在许多地区，未成年人饮酒或酒后驾驶都是违法且危险的。

summary.en: Preimbue means to influence or fill someone/something with a quality or idea beforehand.
summary.zh: preimbue 指“预先灌输/预先注入”，在事前就让某人或某物带有某种品质或观念。

definition.en: to imbue (fill with a quality, feeling, or idea) in advance; to influence or prepare someone/something beforehand with certain values, attitudes, or characteristics
definition.zh: 预先灌输；事先使充满（某种品质、情感或观念）；在之前就让某人/某物带有某种倾向或特质

examples.en: The training program tries to preimbue new staff with a customer-first mindset.
examples.zh: 这个培训项目试图在新员工入职前就预先灌输“顾客至上”的思维。

examples.en: Some parents hope to preimbue their children with a love of reading before school starts.
examples.zh: 有些家长希望在孩子上学前就先培养/灌输他们对阅读的热爱。

examples.en: The opening scene preimbues the story with a sense of dread.
examples.zh: 开场的一幕预先为故事注入了一种不祥的气氛。

extraExplanation: “pre-”是英语前缀，表示“在……之前/预先”。“preimbue”由“pre- + imbue”构成，意思就是“提前灌输/提前注入”。
这个词在现代英语中比较少见，更常用的表达是“imbue (someone/something) with …”（使充满/灌输）或“instill … in …”（灌输）。在正式写作里，用更常见的动词通常更自然。

summary.en: Preimbued means already infused beforehand with a particular quality or feeling.
summary.zh: preimbued 指“事先就被某种特质或情绪浸润/灌注的”。

definition.en: already filled or infused with a particular quality, feeling, or idea beforehand
definition.zh: 事先就被（某种特质、情感或观念）灌注/浸润的；预先带有……色彩的

examples.en: The story feels preimbued with sadness, even before anything tragic happens.
examples.zh: 这个故事在悲剧发生之前就已经预先浸润着悲伤。

examples.en: Her questions were preimbued with suspicion, so the interview felt tense.
examples.zh: 她的问题预先带着怀疑，因此采访气氛很紧张。

examples.en: Many readers think the poem is preimbued with nostalgia for childhood.
examples.zh: 许多读者认为这首诗预先带着对童年的怀旧情绪。

extraExplanation: “preimbued”不是特别常见的标准词，更常见的写法/表达是“already imbued (with …)”“imbued beforehand”或“pre-loaded with …”。它由前缀“pre-（预先）”+ “imbued（被灌注/浸润的）”构成，常用于文学评论或较正式的写作中，强调某种情绪/价值判断在一开始就存在。

summary.en: “Preimbuing” is a rare form meaning “imbuing beforehand”—instilling a quality or idea in advance.
summary.zh: “preimbuing”较罕见，意思是“预先灌输/事先使充满（某种品质或观念）”。

definition.en: (Rare) To imbue in advance; to fill someone or something beforehand with a quality, feeling, or idea.
definition.zh: （罕用）预先灌输；事先使（某人/某物）充满某种品质、情感或观念。

examples.en: The program aims to preimbue new employees with a strong sense of customer care before they meet clients.
examples.zh: 这个项目旨在让新员工在见客户之前就预先建立强烈的客户服务意识。

examples.en: Some schools try to preimbue students with civic responsibility through community service.
examples.zh: 一些学校通过社区服务来预先培养学生的公民责任感。

extraExplanation: “preimbuing”通常是由前缀 pre-（预先）+ imbue（灌输/使充满）构成的非正式或非常少见的用法，在现代英语里不算常见词条。更自然的表达往往是：imbue someone with..., instill..., or prepare someone to...。
词形上：preimbue（动词原形）→ preimbued（过去式/过去分词）→ preimbuing（现在分词/动名词）。
使用提示：如果写作需要更地道，通常直接用“imbue”并加上时间或方式状语即可，比如 “imbue students early on with...” 来表达“尽早灌输”。

summary.en: “Preimitate” isn’t a standard word; it’s usually a misspelling of “premeditate” (to plan beforehand, often a crime).
summary.zh: “preimitate”不是标准单词；通常是把“premeditate”（预谋、事先策划，常用于犯罪）拼错了。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; most commonly a misspelling of “premeditate.”
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；最常见的是把“premeditate”拼错了。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “preimitate” in the dictionary—did you mean “premeditate”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“preimitate”——你是不是想写“premeditate”？

examples.en: Try rewriting the sentence with “premeditate” if you mean “plan beforehand.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“事先计划”，可以用“premeditate”改写这句话。

extraExplanation: 你可能想写的是：premeditate /priˈmɛdɪˌteɪt/（动词），意思是“预谋、事先策划（尤指犯罪）”。例如：The attack was premeditated.（这次袭击是预谋的。）
如果你本意是“提前模仿/预先模仿”，英语里一般不会用 *preimitate* 这种写法；更自然的表达是：imitate in advance / copy beforehand，或根据语境改成 practice by copying（通过模仿练习）。
如果你把原句发我，我可以帮你判断你更想用“premeditate”还是其他更合适的词。

summary.en: “Premeditated” means planned in advance; “preimitated” is likely a misspelling.
summary.zh: “premeditated”意为“事先计划的/预谋的”；“preimitated”很可能是拼写错误。

definition.en: (Often used in law) Planned or thought about before doing it; not done by accident or on impulse.
definition.zh: （常用于法律）预先计划好的；事先考虑过的；非一时冲动或意外造成的。

examples.en: The attack was premeditated, not a sudden fight.
examples.zh: 这次袭击是预谋的，不是突发斗殴。

examples.en: Prosecutors argued it was a premeditated murder.
examples.zh: 检方认为这是一起预谋杀人。

examples.en: Her apology sounded premeditated, as if she had practiced it.
examples.zh: 她的道歉听起来像是事先准备过的，仿佛练习过。

definition.en: To plan or think about something before doing it (especially a harmful act).
definition.zh: 预谋；事先策划；事先考虑（尤指做坏事之前）。

examples.en: They premeditated the robbery for weeks.
examples.zh: 他们为这次抢劫预谋了好几个星期。

examples.en: The jury had to decide whether he premeditated the act.
examples.zh: 陪审团必须判断他是否是预谋实施该行为。

extraExplanation:
你输入的“preimitated”通常是拼写错误，更常见、正确的词是 **premeditated**（预谋的）。

在英美法律语境里，**premeditated** 常与 **murder** 连用（premeditated murder），强调“事先有计划”，通常比“冲动行为”更严重。

summary.en: Premeditating means planning something in advance, especially deliberately (often in a legal context).
summary.zh: Premeditating 指“事先预谋、蓄意计划”，常见于法律语境。

definition.en: planning or thinking about something (often a harmful act) before doing it; doing it intentionally rather than by accident.
definition.zh: 事先计划或思考（常指伤害性行为）；有意为之而非一时冲动或意外。

examples.en: He was premeditating the robbery for weeks.
examples.zh: 他为这次抢劫预谋了好几个星期。

examples.en: The lawyer argued the act was not premeditating but impulsive.
examples.zh: 律师辩称这不是预谋，而是一时冲动。

definition.en: (especially in law) done after planning ahead; deliberate.
definition.zh: （尤用于法律）预谋的；蓄意的；事先计划好的。

examples.en: The prosecution tried to prove it was a premeditating attack.
examples.zh: 控方试图证明这是一次预谋袭击。

examples.en: Premeditating intent can affect how a crime is punished.
examples.zh: 预谋的意图会影响犯罪的量刑。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **preimitating** 很可能是拼写误差，更常见的词是 **premeditating**（来自 *pre-*“事先” + *meditate*“深思、谋划”）。
在英语里，*premeditated / premeditating* 常出现在犯罪与法律语境中，表示“不是临时起意，而是事先计划”。日常表达里也可用于较轻的事情，但语气仍偏“刻意/蓄意”。

summary.en: Premeditation means planning something in advance, often used in legal contexts to mean a crime was planned rather than impulsive.
summary.zh: Premeditation 指事先计划/预谋，常用于法律语境，强调行为是提前策划而非一时冲动。

definition.en: the act of planning something (especially a harmful act) carefully before doing it
definition.zh: 事先周密计划（尤指伤害或犯罪行为）；预谋

examples.en: The prosecutor argued that the murder was done with premeditation.
examples.zh: 检察官认为这起谋杀是预谋实施的。

examples.en: The evidence suggested premeditation rather than an accident.
examples.zh: 证据显示这更像是预谋，而不是意外。

definition.en: careful thought about something before acting
definition.zh: 在行动前的深思熟虑

examples.en: With a little premeditation, the trip could have gone much more smoothly.
examples.zh: 如果事先多做些考虑，这次旅行本可以顺利得多。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“preimitation”很可能是拼写错误，常见正确词是“premeditation”（预谋/事先计划）。
“premeditation”在法律语境中很常见，尤其与“murder（谋杀）”搭配，用来强调行为不是一时冲动，而是提前计划好的；这会影响罪名或量刑。
词形提示：pre-（预先）+ meditation（思考/沉思）→ 先思考再行动。注意它不是“imitation（模仿）”相关的词。

summary.en: Preimitative means “before imitation; not yet imitative,” and is a rare term used mainly in academic contexts.
summary.zh: preimitative 指“模仿之前的、尚未模仿的”，较罕见，多见于学术语境。

definition.en: (rare) Existing or happening before a stage of imitation; not yet imitative.
definition.zh: （罕见）处于“模仿阶段”之前的；尚未开始模仿的。

examples.en: In child development, some researchers describe early vocal play as a preimitative stage.
examples.zh: 在儿童发展研究中，有些学者把早期的发声游戏称为“前模仿阶段”。

examples.en: The artist’s notebooks show a preimitative style—more exploration than copying.
examples.zh: 这位艺术家的笔记显示出一种前模仿风格——更多是探索而非临摹。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“imitative”表示“模仿性的”。因此 preimitative（或更常写作 pre-imitative）直译为“模仿之前的”。
这个词在日常英语中非常少见，更常见的表达有：pre-imitation stage（模仿前阶段）、non-imitative（非模仿性的）、original（原创的）。
在学术语境里（如儿童语言发展、学习理论、艺术史）更可能遇到这个词，用来强调“尚未进入靠模仿来学习/创作的阶段”。

summary.en: Preimmigration means “before immigration,” often used in research or official contexts.
summary.zh: preimmigration 表示“移民前的”，常用于研究或官方语境。

definition.en: Happening or existing before a person immigrates to a new country.
definition.zh: （某人）移民到新国家之前发生的；移民前的。

examples.en: The study examined preimmigration health and stress levels.
examples.zh: 这项研究考察了移民前的健康状况和压力水平。

examples.en: Preimmigration experiences can shape how easily people adapt later.
examples.zh: 移民前的经历会影响人们之后适应新环境的难易。

examples.en: They collected preimmigration records, such as school transcripts and job histories.
examples.zh: 他们收集了移民前的资料，比如成绩单和工作经历。

extraExplanation: “preimmigration”更常见的写法是“pre-immigration”（加连字符），尤其在学术论文、政府文件或正式写作中。两种写法含义相同。
这个词常用于社会科学与公共卫生语境，如“pre-immigration trauma（移民前创伤）”“pre-immigration screening（移民前筛查）”“pre-immigration status（移民前身份/状况）”。

summary.en: Preimmunization means getting immunized in advance, before likely exposure to a disease.
summary.zh: preimmunization 指在可能接触疾病之前提前进行免疫（如接种疫苗）。

definition.en: Immunization (vaccination or other immune preparation) done in advance, especially before exposure to a disease or before starting a program such as a study, travel, or medical treatment.
definition.zh: 预先免疫；预防性免疫（指在可能接触疾病之前，提前进行接种或其他免疫准备）。

examples.en: Preimmunization against hepatitis B is recommended for many healthcare workers.
examples.zh: 许多医护人员建议在上岗前进行乙型肝炎的预先免疫。

examples.en: The clinic schedule includes preimmunization before the trip to areas with higher infection risk.
examples.zh: 诊所的安排包括在前往感染风险较高地区旅行前的预先免疫。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于医学与公共卫生语境，尤其在疫苗研究、临床试验或旅行医学中。日常英语里更常说“vaccination before … / prior vaccination / pre-vaccination”。
构词法：pre-（在……之前）+ immunization（免疫/接种）。有时也会看到“preimmunize”(v.)、“preimmunized”(adj.)等派生形式。

summary.en: Vaccinations given in advance, before a planned exposure, procedure, or study.
summary.zh: 指在计划的暴露、操作或研究开始前提前接种的疫苗。

definition.en: Vaccinations given before a planned exposure, treatment, procedure, or study (plural of “preimmunization”).
definition.zh: 在计划中的暴露、治疗、手术或研究开始之前接种的疫苗（“preimmunization”的复数）。

examples.en: All participants must complete their preimmunizations at least two weeks before traveling.
examples.zh: 所有参与者必须在出行前至少两周完成预先免疫接种。

examples.en: The clinic reviewed the child’s preimmunizations before starting immunosuppressive therapy.
examples.zh: 诊所在开始免疫抑制治疗前核对了孩子的预先接种情况。

examples.en: Researchers recorded preimmunizations to compare antibody levels later.
examples.zh: 研究人员记录了预先接种情况，以便之后比较抗体水平。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的说法是 **pre-immunization vaccinations/shots**（带连字符）或直接说 **vaccinations before…**。在医学/科研语境中会用来强调“在某项干预或暴露发生之前，先把需要的疫苗打完”。
拼写上有时会看到 **preimmunization**（不加连字符）或 **pre-immunization**（更清晰、也更常见）。两者通常意思相同，具体用法可能取决于机构写作规范。

summary.en: Preimmunize means to immunize someone in advance, before they are likely to be exposed to a disease.
summary.zh: preimmunize 指在可能接触疾病之前提前进行免疫，使其预先获得保护。

definition.en: to immunize someone in advance (before a likely exposure), usually by giving a vaccine or preparing the immune system ahead of time
definition.zh: 预先免疫；提前使（某人）获得免疫力（通常指在可能接触病原体之前接种疫苗或提前建立免疫保护）

examples.en: Health workers tried to preimmunize children before the rainy season, when outbreaks often increase.
examples.zh: 卫生人员尽量在雨季到来前为儿童预先免疫，因为雨季常常更容易出现疫情。

examples.en: The study tested whether preimmunizing mice reduced symptoms after infection.
examples.zh: 该研究测试预先免疫小鼠是否能在感染后减轻症状。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，因此 preimmunize 字面意思就是“在之前就完成免疫”。该词在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的说法是 immunize beforehand / vaccinate in advance。
语境上它常用于科研论文、公共卫生计划或疫苗策略讨论中，强调“提前建立保护”，而不是暴露后再处理。

summary.en: Preimmunized means already immunized in advance, usually by vaccination, before a later exposure or risk period.
summary.zh: preimmunized 指在之后接触或风险期之前就已提前获得免疫（通常通过接种疫苗）。

definition.en: already made immune (or less likely to get sick) before a later exposure, usually through vaccination or earlier treatment.
definition.zh: （通常通过疫苗或先前处理）在之后接触病原体之前就已经获得免疫力/较不易生病的。

examples.en: The preimmunized group showed fewer severe symptoms after the outbreak.
examples.zh: 在疫情暴发后，预先免疫的那一组出现的重症症状更少。

examples.en: Healthcare workers were preimmunized against hepatitis B before starting clinical work.
examples.zh: 医护人员在开始临床工作前会先接种疫苗以预先获得乙肝免疫力。

definition.en: (of a person or animal) vaccinated in advance; given an immunization before a particular risk period.
definition.zh: （人或动物）提前接种过疫苗的；在某个风险期到来前已完成免疫接种的。

examples.en: Only preimmunized travelers were allowed to join the expedition to the remote area.
examples.zh: 只有提前完成免疫接种的旅行者才被允许参加前往偏远地区的探险。

examples.en: The shelter kept records to confirm which dogs were preimmunized.
examples.zh: 收容所保存记录以确认哪些狗已提前接种过疫苗。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，因此 preimmunized 强调“提前获得免疫”。它常见于医学、公共卫生、动物实验或临床试验语境，用来区分“已免疫/未免疫”的对照组。
日常英语中，人们更常说 vaccinated / immunized；preimmunized 更偏书面和专业，用于强调“在某次暴露或研究开始之前就已经完成免疫”。

summary.en: “Preimmunizes” means “gives immunity or resistance in advance,” literally (medical) or figuratively (against bad ideas or influence).
summary.zh: “preimmunizes”表示“提前使……获得免疫/抵抗力”，既可指医学上的免疫，也可引申为对不良影响提前建立抵抗。

definition.en: to give someone or something immunity in advance (for example, by vaccinating or exposing them safely before a likely later exposure).
definition.zh: 使（某人/某物）提前获得免疫力（例如在可能的暴露之前，通过接种疫苗或安全的方式提前建立免疫）。

examples.en: The clinic preimmunizes travelers against common infections before they leave.
examples.zh: 诊所会在旅客出发前为他们提前接种，使其获得对常见感染的免疫力。

examples.en: Some lab animals are preimmunized so researchers can study how their immune systems respond.
examples.zh: 有些实验动物会被提前免疫，以便研究人员观察它们的免疫系统如何反应。

definition.en: to protect someone in advance from a negative influence (used more broadly, often in psychology or education).
definition.zh: （引申）使（某人）提前产生“防御/免疫”，以抵抗不良影响（常用于心理学或教育语境）。

examples.en: Teaching students how misinformation works can preimmunize them against online rumors.
examples.zh: 教学生了解虚假信息的运作方式，可以让他们对网络谣言提前“免疫”。

examples.en: Clear communication preimmunizes a team against panic during a crisis.
examples.zh: 清晰的沟通能让团队在危机中提前“免疫”于恐慌。

extraExplanation: “preimmunizes”是动词“preimmunize”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it preimmunizes）。常见搭配：preimmunize someone against/from something（使某人对……提前免疫/有抵抗力）。
医学语境中更常见的表达还包括“immunize (against)”和“vaccinate (against)”。“pre-”强调“事先/提前”的时间顺序，常用于说明在风险到来之前先建立保护。

summary.en: Preimmunizing means immunizing in advance, before expected exposure to a disease.
summary.zh: preimmunizing 指在预期暴露于疾病之前进行预先免疫。

definition.en: immunizing (a person or animal) in advance—giving a vaccine or other preventive treatment before expected exposure to a disease.
definition.zh: 预先免疫；在可能接触疾病之前，提前接种疫苗或采取其他预防性免疫措施。

examples.en: The clinic is preimmunizing travelers against hepatitis A before their trip.
examples.zh: 诊所正在为旅行者在出发前预先接种甲肝疫苗。

examples.en: Researchers began preimmunizing the mice to see whether the new vaccine could prevent infection.
examples.zh: 研究人员开始对小鼠进行预先免疫，以观察新疫苗是否能预防感染。

definition.en: (as an adjective) intended to create immunity in advance.
definition.zh: （作形容词）用于“预先产生免疫力”的；预先免疫的。

examples.en: A preimmunizing dose may be given weeks before the main series.
examples.zh: 预先免疫剂量可能会在主要接种程序前数周给予。

extraExplanation: “preimmunizing”来自动词“preimmunize”（pre- + immunize），多见于医学、公共卫生与科研语境，日常口语更常说“vaccinating people ahead of time / in advance”。
在专业写作中，它常用于强调“在暴露风险之前就建立免疫保护”，例如出国旅行前接种、流行季前的预防接种，或动物实验中先做免疫处理。

summary.en: “Preimpair” is a rare/nonstandard verb meaning “to impair in advance”; clearer alternatives are usually preferred.
summary.zh: “preimpair”很少见、偏非标准，意为“事先损害/预先削弱”；一般建议用更自然的替代表达。

definition.en: A rare or nonstandard word formed from pre- + impair, meaning “to impair beforehand” or “to cause damage to something before a later event.” In most writing, people use clearer alternatives.
definition.zh: 一个很少见、偏非标准的构词（pre- + impair），大意是“事先损害/预先削弱”，指在后续事件发生前就让某物受损。实际写作中通常用更自然的表达替代。

examples.en: A childhood injury can preimpair balance, making sports harder later in life.
examples.zh: 童年受伤可能会“预先损害”平衡能力，导致以后运动更困难。

examples.en: Poor maintenance may preimpair the system, so it fails during peak demand.
examples.zh: 维护不良可能会事先削弱系统，因此在高峰需求时出故障。

extraExplanation: “preimpair”在主流词典与常见语料中几乎不出现，读者可能会觉得生硬或难懂。更自然的替代说法包括：impair beforehand / impair in advance（事先削弱）、cause early damage（早期造成损害）、pre-existing impairment（既有/先天性损伤，名词短语）。
如果你是在医学、保险或法律语境中表达“原本就有的功能受损”，通常用 pre-existing impairment / prior impairment，而不是动词“preimpair”。

summary.en: “Preimpairment” means “before an impairment,” often describing someone’s prior level of function or health status.
summary.zh: “preimpairment”指“发生功能障碍/受损之前”，常用来描述受损前的健康状况或功能水平。

definition.en: (mainly medical/insurance) Existing before an impairment (loss of function or ability) happens; referring to the person’s condition or level of ability before the impairment.
definition.zh: （多用于医学/保险语境）发生功能受损（障碍）之前就存在的；指受损发生前的身体状况或能力水平。

examples.en: The therapist compared her current mobility with her preimpairment level.
examples.zh: 治疗师把她现在的行动能力与受损前的水平作了比较。

examples.en: The report describes his preimpairment health status and daily routines.
examples.zh: 报告描述了他受损前的健康状况和日常生活习惯。

definition.en: A person’s condition, ability, or functioning before an impairment occurs (often used in the phrase “preimpairment baseline”).
definition.zh: 受损发生前的状态/能力/功能水平（常见于短语“preimpairment baseline”，即“受损前基线水平”）。

examples.en: We don’t have enough data to establish his preimpairment baseline.
examples.zh: 我们没有足够的数据来确定他受损前的基线水平。

examples.en: The goal is to return the patient as close as possible to preimpairment.
examples.zh: 目标是让患者尽可能恢复到受损前的状态。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里不常见，更常见的写法是加连字符的“pre-impairment”，或用更通用的表达：医疗语境常说“premorbid (status/function)”（发病/受损前的状态），事故/工伤语境也常说“pre-injury”或“prior level of function (PLOF)”。
在正式写作中，若要强调“受损前”是一个前缀结构，使用“pre-impairment”更清晰；不加连字符的“preimpairment”多见于内部表格、报告字段名或特定机构文件。

summary.en: “Preimpart” is a very rare/nonstandard verb meaning “to impart something beforehand.”
summary.zh: “preimpart”是非常少见/非标准动词，意思是“提前传达/给予（impart）”。

definition.en: (Very rare / nonstandard) To impart (give, communicate, or pass on) something beforehand; to provide in advance.
definition.zh: （非常少见／非标准用法）在事前传达、给予或灌输；提前提供。

examples.en: The guide preimparted a few safety rules before we entered the cave.
examples.zh: 在我们进入洞穴之前，导游提前讲了几条安全规则。

examples.en: Some teachers try to preimpart key vocabulary so students can follow the reading more easily.
examples.zh: 有些老师会提前讲授关键词汇，让学生更容易跟上阅读。

extraExplanation: “preimpart”不是常见词，很多词典里查不到；更自然的表达通常是用“impart … beforehand / in advance（提前传达）”“give/provide … in advance（提前提供）”或“brief … beforehand（事先简要说明）”。
构词上可以理解为前缀“pre-（预先）”+“impart（传授/告知）”。写作时若用它，读者可能觉得生造或不地道；正式写作更建议用上面那些常见搭配。

summary.en: Preimperial means “before the imperial/empire period.”
summary.zh: preimperial 指“帝国（帝制）时期之前的；前帝国时期的”。

definition.en: Existing, happening, or relating to the time before an empire was established or before an “imperial” period began.
definition.zh: 帝国建立之前的；帝制时期之前的；与“前帝国时期”有关的。

examples.en: Archaeologists found preimperial pottery beneath the imperial palace ruins.
examples.zh: 考古学家在帝国宫殿遗址下方发现了前帝国时期的陶器。

examples.en: The museum’s exhibit explains how preimperial politics shaped later expansion.
examples.zh: 博物馆的展览说明了前帝国时期的政治如何影响了后来的扩张。

examples.en: She studies preimperial Rome to understand the roots of Roman imperial power.
examples.zh: 她研究前帝国时期的罗马，以了解罗马帝国权力的根源。

extraExplanation: “preimperial”常见于历史、考古、艺术史等语境，用来把“帝国/帝制时代”与更早的阶段区分开来（例如“preimperial Rome”“preimperial China”等）。
拼写上也常见作“pre-imperial”（带连字符），两者意思相同；学术写作中是否加连字符通常取决于期刊/出版社的风格指南。
词义较中性，重点是时间上的“在帝国时期之前”，不必然包含价值判断。

summary.en: “Preimplantation” describes the period or conditions before an embryo implants in the uterus, especially in fertility medicine.
summary.zh: “preimplantation”指胚胎在子宫着床之前的阶段或相关情况，常用于生殖医学语境。

definition.en: Before an embryo implants in the uterus (womb).
definition.zh: 着床前的；胚胎在子宫（子宫内膜）着床之前的。

examples.en: Preimplantation genetic testing can check for certain genetic conditions before pregnancy begins.
examples.zh: 着床前基因检测可以在怀孕开始前检查某些遗传疾病。

examples.en: Doctors monitor embryo development during the preimplantation stage in IVF.
examples.zh: 在试管婴儿过程中，医生会监测胚胎在着床前阶段的发育。

extraExplanation: 这个词多见于医学与生殖领域，尤其是 IVF（体外受精/试管婴儿）相关语境。常见搭配包括：preimplantation embryo（着床前胚胎）、preimplantation development（着床前发育）、preimplantation genetic testing / diagnosis，简称 PGT/PGD（着床前遗传学检测/诊断）。

summary.en: Preimport means to import or load something ahead of time, often in software contexts.
summary.zh: Preimport 指在需要之前先导入/加载某些内容，常见于软件与技术语境。

definition.en: to import something in advance (especially in computing: to load a module/library or bring data in before it is needed).
definition.zh: 预先导入；提前导入（尤用于计算机：在需要之前先加载模块/库或导入数据）。

examples.en: Some apps preimport common fonts to make the first screen load faster.
examples.zh: 有些应用会预先导入常用字体，让首屏加载更快。

examples.en: We preimported the customer list before the demo started.
examples.zh: 演示开始前，我们先把客户名单预先导入了。

definition.en: an advance import; something that is imported ahead of time.
definition.zh: 预先导入的内容；提前导入（这一动作或结果）。

examples.en: The preimport reduced the amount of work during the live session.
examples.zh: 这次预先导入减少了现场环节的工作量。

extraExplanation: “preimport”不是非常常见的通用英语词，更多出现在技术写作、代码注释或产品文档里，意思通常等同于“import beforehand”。实际写作中也常见写成“pre-import”（加连字符）以便更清晰。
在编程语境里，它常涉及“提前加载依赖/模块/资源”，目的通常是提升启动速度、减少运行时卡顿，或避免第一次使用时才加载导致的延迟。

summary.en: “Preimportance” is a rare, nonstandard noun meaning “prior/advance importance.”
summary.zh: “preimportance”是罕见且不太规范的名词，意为“事先/先前的重要性”。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) importance that exists beforehand; importance given in advance or before something happens.
definition.zh: （罕见、非规范用法）预先的重要性；在事情发生前就被赋予/被认为的重要程度。

examples.en: The author argues for the preimportance of early childhood education in later success.
examples.zh: 作者主张：幼儿教育对日后成功具有预先的重要性。

examples.en: In most writing, it’s clearer to say “the prior importance of nutrition” instead of “preimportance.”
examples.zh: 在大多数写作中，用“营养的先前重要性（prior importance）”会比“preimportance”更清楚。

extraExplanation: “preimportance”并不是常见或标准的英语词，读者可能会觉得不自然。它可以被理解为前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ importance（“重要性”）的临时造词。

更地道的替代说法取决于你想表达的意思：
- 强调“事先/先前的重要性”：prior importance, earlier importance, importance beforehand
- 强调“最重要、居首位”：primacy, preeminence, overriding importance
- 强调“优先次序/优先权”：priority, precedence
如果你提供一句原文语境，我可以帮你选最合适的标准表达。

summary.en: “Preimportant” is a nonstandard word people sometimes use to mean “important beforehand” or “extremely important,” but standard alternatives are recommended.
summary.zh: “preimportant”不是标准英语词，常被用来表示“事先重要”或“极其重要”，但更建议用常见替代表达。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Important before something else happens; important in advance.
definition.zh: （非标准用法）在某事发生之前就很重要；事先重要。

examples.en: Please read the safety rules first—they’re preimportant for the lab.
examples.zh: 请先读安全规则——它们对实验室来说是事先很重要的。

examples.en: Getting the permit is preimportant before you start building.
examples.zh: 在开始施工前，拿到许可证是事先很重要的。

definition.en: (Often intended meaning, but better expressed with other words) Extremely important; more important than others.
definition.zh: （常见本意，但更建议用其他词表达）极其重要；比其他更重要。

examples.en: In emergencies, clear communication is preimportant.
examples.zh: 在紧急情况下，清晰沟通是极其重要的。

examples.en: Sleep is preimportant for your health.
examples.zh: 睡眠对你的健康极其重要。

extraExplanation: “preimportant”在英语里不是常见或标准的词，很多情况下读者会觉得别扭或不确定你的意思。
如果你想表达“事先重要/提前要做”，更自然的说法是：important beforehand / important in advance / a priority before… / prerequisite / preliminary（如：a prerequisite step 前置条件）。
如果你想表达“极其重要/最重要”，更地道的词是：very important / crucial / essential / paramount / of primary importance。
写正式英文时建议避免“preimportant”，改用上面这些更常用的表达。

summary.en: A rare, nonstandard adverb meaning “before an important point; to introduce something more important.”
summary.zh: 一个罕见、非标准的副词，表示“在重要内容之前；用来引出更重要的要点”。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) Before something important; in advance of an important point.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准）在重要内容之前；在提出要点之前（用来引出接下来更重要的话）。

examples.en: Preimportantly, we need to confirm the budget before we discuss the design.
examples.zh: 更重要的是（或在讨论设计之前），我们需要先确认预算。

examples.en: Preimportantly, let me clarify one safety rule.
examples.zh: 在讲更重要的内容之前，我先澄清一条安全规则。

extraExplanation:
“preimportantly”在现代英语中非常少见，很多读者会觉得别扭或不自然。正式写作里通常用：
- “More importantly, … / Most importantly, …”（更重要的是……）
- “Before I get to the important part, …”（在进入重点之前……）
如果你想表达“尤其、主要地（在众多之中最重要）”，更常用“preeminently”。

summary.en: Preimportation means the steps or requirements that happen before goods are imported.
summary.zh: preimportation 指货物进口之前的步骤或要求。

definition.en: the period, steps, or conditions that happen before goods are imported into a country
definition.zh: （货物）进口前阶段；进口前的步骤或条件

examples.en: The company must complete preimportation paperwork before the shipment can enter the country.
examples.zh: 货物入境前，公司必须完成进口前的文件手续。

examples.en: Preimportation inspections can reduce delays at the port.
examples.zh: 进口前检验可以减少港口延误。

definition.en: (law/business) relating to requirements that apply before importation, such as inspection, permits, or documentation
definition.zh: （法律/商务）与进口前要求有关的（如检验、许可或文件）

examples.en: The contract includes preimportation compliance requirements.
examples.zh: 合同包含进口前合规要求。

examples.en: They asked for proof of preimportation certification.
examples.zh: 他们要求提供进口前认证的证明。

extraExplanation: “preimportation”在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的写法是“pre-importation”（加连字符），尤其在海关、贸易合规语境中。
常见搭配：pre-importation inspection（进口前检验）、pre-importation permit（进口前许可）、pre-importation documentation（进口前文件）。
注意不要和“importation”（进口）混淆：preimportation强调“进口之前”的准备或要求。

summary.en: “Preimposal” is not standard; it likely means “preproposal” (an early proposal) or less likely relates to “imposition.”
summary.zh: “preimposal”不是标准用词；很可能是“preproposal（预提案）”，也可能（较不常见）想表达与“imposition（强加/负担）”相关的意思。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it is most likely a misspelling or typo.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语词；很可能是拼写错误或打字错误。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “preimposal” in the dictionary—did you mean “preproposal”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“preimposal”——你是不是想写“preproposal（预提案）”？

examples.en: If you meant “imposition,” it describes something that is unfairly forced on someone.
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“imposition”，它指把某事不公平地强加给别人。

definition.en: (Likely intended) preproposal: an early or informal proposal made before a formal proposal.
definition.zh: （可能想表达）preproposal：正式提案之前的初步/非正式提案。

examples.en: We shared a preproposal with the team to get feedback before writing the final plan.
examples.zh: 我们先把预提案发给团队征求反馈，再写最终方案。

examples.en: The grant process starts with a short preproposal.
examples.zh: 申请资助的流程从一份简短的预提案开始。

extraExplanation:
“preimposal”在常见词典和语料中几乎不存在，通常可以判断为拼写错误。最常见的两种可能：
1) 想写“preproposal”（预提案）：pre-（在……之前）+ proposal（提案）。
2) 想写“imposition”（强加；负担）：与“impose on”（把……强加给……）相关。
如果你告诉我句子上下文，我可以帮你确定最准确的目标词。

summary.en: Preimpose means to impose something beforehand—often a condition, rule, or expectation (rarely, to overlay something in advance).
summary.zh: Preimpose 指“预先强加/预先施加”某种条件、规则或期待（少数情况下也指预先叠加/覆盖）。

definition.en: to impose or apply (a rule, condition, or burden) in advance; to set something as a prior requirement
definition.zh: 预先强加（规则、条件或负担）；事先设定为前提条件

examples.en: The contract seems to preimpose strict penalties before any negotiation begins.
examples.zh: 这份合同似乎在谈判开始前就预先强加了严格的罚则。

examples.en: They shouldn’t preimpose one culture’s standards on everyone in the group.
examples.zh: 他们不应该把某一种文化的标准预先强加给团队里的所有人。

definition.en: to place or lay something over something else beforehand; to superimpose in advance (rare)
definition.zh: （较少用）预先叠加；事先覆盖在……之上

examples.en: The designer preimposed a faint grid on the poster to guide alignment.
examples.zh: 设计师在海报上预先叠加了淡淡的网格来帮助对齐。

extraExplanation: “preimpose”由前缀 pre-（“预先”）+ impose（“强加/施加”）构成，意思通常就是“提前施加”。这个词在现代英语里比较少见，写作中更常用的表达是 “impose in advance / set in advance / pre-set / precondition”。
在社会与文化语境里，preimpose 常带有“未经同意就先定规矩”的批评意味，例如讨论制度、权力或文化标准时。

summary.en: Preimposed means set or imposed beforehand (often by rules, conditions, or assumptions).
summary.zh: preimposed 指“预先施加的/事先设定的”，常用于规则、条件或先入假设。

definition.en: (adj.) Set, arranged, or forced onto something beforehand (often by rules, conditions, or assumptions).
definition.zh: （形容词）预先施加的；事先设定或强加的（常指规则、条件或假设）。

examples.en: The study followed a preimposed schedule, so there was little flexibility.
examples.zh: 这项研究遵循预先设定的时间表，所以几乎没有灵活性。

examples.en: Try not to judge people using preimposed ideas about their culture.
examples.zh: 尽量不要用对他人文化的先入之见来评判别人。

definition.en: (v., past tense/past participle of “preimpose”) To impose or apply something in advance.
definition.zh: （动词，preimpose 的过去式/过去分词）预先施加；事先强加。

examples.en: The rules were preimposed by the committee before the project began.
examples.zh: 委员会在项目开始前就预先制定并施加了这些规则。

extraExplanation: “preimposed”在学术写作里更常见，语气偏正式；日常英语里更常用“pre-set / predetermined / imposed in advance”。
有时也会写成“pre-imposed”（加连字符），意思不变；是否加连字符取决于写作风格指南。

summary.en: “Preimposing” means imposing something beforehand (often rules or conditions).
summary.zh: “preimposing”指“事先施加/预先强加”，常用于规则或条件等。

definition.en: (present participle of preimpose) putting a rule, condition, or burden on someone or something in advance; imposing beforehand.
definition.zh: （preimpose 的现在分词）事先施加（规则、条件、负担等）；预先强加。

examples.en: The contract avoids preimposing penalties before the investigation is finished.
examples.zh: 合同避免在调查结束前就预先施加处罚。

examples.en: The teacher worried that preimposing strict rules would discourage new learners.
examples.zh: 老师担心预先施加严格规定会打击初学者的积极性。

definition.en: describing something that is imposed in advance.
definition.zh: 形容预先被施加的；事先强加的。

examples.en: They rejected the preimposing restrictions on travel.
examples.zh: 他们拒绝那些对出行的预先限制。

examples.en: A preimposing demand for payment can feel unfair.
examples.zh: 预先要求付款可能让人觉得不公平。

extraExplanation: “preimpose”在现代英语里非常少见，更多场合会用更自然的表达：impose in advance / impose beforehand / set in advance / place conditions on…。
常见搭配语境包括：rules（规则）, restrictions（限制）, conditions（条件）, penalties（惩罚）, obligations（义务）。在法律、合同或政策讨论中更可能看到这种词。

summary.en: “Preimposition” means imposing something in advance—setting a condition, rule, or assumption beforehand.
summary.zh: “preimposition”指“预先施加”：在事前就把条件、规则或预设强加上去。

definition.en: A prior imposition; the act of placing, applying, or forcing something onto someone or something in advance (before another action, event, or decision).
definition.zh: 预先施加；在某个行动、事件或决定之前，先把某种安排、条件、要求或影响加诸于人或事物。

examples.en: The policy was criticized as a preimposition that limited schools’ freedom before any discussion began.
examples.zh: 这项政策被批评为一种“预先施加”的做法，在任何讨论开始前就限制了学校的自主权。

examples.en: In some experiments, the preimposition of strict rules can change how participants behave.
examples.zh: 在一些实验中，预先施加严格规则会改变参与者的行为。

extraExplanation: “preimposition”非常少见，更多时候英语会用更自然的表达来替代，例如：a prior constraint（事先的限制）、an imposed assumption（强加的预设）、pre-set condition（预设条件）、imposed beforehand（事先施加的）。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ imposition（强加/施加）。写作中若使用该词，通常带有批评意味：强调某种规则、观点或条件“还没讨论/验证就先被强加”。

summary.en: Preimpress means to impress someone beforehand, or (in specialized contexts) to pre-stamp/print a mark in advance.
summary.zh: preimpress 指“提前让人印象深刻/先博得好感”，或在专业语境中指“预先压印/印上标记”。

definition.en: to make someone feel admiration or respect before meeting them or before something happens (rare; usually written with a hyphen: pre-impress)
definition.zh: 在见面或事情发生之前就先让某人产生好感/敬佩（较少见；常写作 pre-impress）

examples.en: The portfolio was meant to pre-impress the interview panel before the in-person meeting.
examples.zh: 这份作品集是为了在面试官见面之前就先给他们留下好印象。

examples.en: He tried to pre-impress her with stories about his job.
examples.zh: 他想用自己工作的故事在见面前就先打动她。

definition.en: to mark, stamp, or print a design onto a surface in advance (specialized use, e.g., manufacturing/printing)
definition.zh: 预先把图案/标记压印或印到表面上（专业用法，如制造/印刷）

examples.en: The factory will pre-impress the logo onto the packaging film.
examples.zh: 工厂会把标志预先压印到包装薄膜上。

examples.en: Some forms are pre-impressed with the company seal.
examples.zh: 有些表格会预先印上公司印章。

extraExplanation: “preimpress”在现代英语里非常少见，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-impress”，而日常表达里通常直接说“impress (someone) beforehand / in advance”。
如果你想表达“提前给人留下好印象”，更自然的替代说法包括：“make a good first impression early / win them over before meeting”。
在印刷/制造语境中，“impress”可以指“压印/盖印”（像把图案压到纸上或包装上），所以“pre-impress”会出现在更技术性的说明里。

summary.en: A preimpression is an opinion or impression formed beforehand, often without full information.
summary.zh: preimpression 指在充分了解之前就形成的预先印象或先入之见。

definition.en: an opinion, feeling, or expectation formed in advance (before having full experience or evidence); an early impression that may influence later judgment
definition.zh: 预先形成的印象；先入为主的看法（在充分了解或证据之前产生，可能影响后续判断）

examples.en: I tried to meet her without any preimpression from the rumors online.
examples.zh: 我尽量不带着网上传闻造成的任何先入印象去见她。

examples.en: His preimpression of the city changed after he actually lived there for a month.
examples.zh: 他对这座城市的先入印象在真正住了一个月后改变了。

examples.en: To avoid preimpressions, the judge asked the jury to ignore media coverage.
examples.zh: 为了避免先入为主的影响，法官要求陪审团忽略媒体报道。

extraExplanation: “preimpression”在现代英语里不算常见，很多时候更自然的说法是“preconception（成见/先入之见）”“initial impression（最初印象）”或“expectation（预期）”。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ impression（印象）。在学术或较正式写作中偶尔会用来强调“在真正接触之前就已形成的印象”。

summary.en: Pre‑Impressionism refers to art and artists just before Impressionism that helped lead to it.
summary.zh: Pre‑Impressionism（前印象派）指印象派出现之前、并对其形成有铺垫作用的艺术及艺术家。

definition.en: a general label for European art (especially French painting) in the mid‑1800s that came just before Impressionism and helped lead to it, often focusing on everyday life, natural light, and painting outdoors
definition.zh: “印象派之前”的一种统称，指19世纪中期（尤其是法国）在印象派兴起前、并对其形成有铺垫作用的艺术（多指绘画），常关注日常题材、自然光与户外写生

examples.en: The museum’s Pre‑Impressionism gallery includes landscape studies painted outdoors.
examples.zh: 博物馆的“前印象派”展厅里有不少在户外完成的风景习作。

examples.en: Some teachers use “Pre‑Impressionism” to connect Realism and early modern painting.
examples.zh: 有些老师用“前印象派”来衔接现实主义与早期现代绘画。

definition.en: describing art or artists that are considered to belong to (or influence) the period just before Impressionism
definition.zh: 用于形容被认为属于（或影响）印象派兴起前时期的艺术或艺术家

examples.en: They discussed a Pre‑Impressionist approach to color and light.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了一种“前印象派式”的色彩与光线处理。

examples.en: The course covers Pre‑Impressionist painters alongside the later Impressionists.
examples.zh: 这门课把前印象派画家与后来的印象派画家放在一起讲。

extraExplanation: “Pre‑Impressionism/前印象派”不是像“Impressionism/印象派”那样非常固定、人人一致的流派名称，更常见于教学或策展时的“过渡期”分类。不同作者可能把巴比松画派（Barbizon School）、现实主义（Realism，如库尔贝 Courbet）、甚至早期马奈（Manet）等放入这个框架，强调它们如何为印象派的户外光色与现代生活题材做铺垫。
书写上常见两种形式：Pre‑Impressionism（带连字符更常见）与 Preimpressionism（较少见）。专有名词作形容词时常写作 Pre‑Impressionist。

summary.en: Pre-Impressionist describes art or artists that came before and helped lead to Impressionism.
summary.zh: pre-Impressionist 指印象派之前、并对印象派形成有铺垫作用的艺术风格/作品或艺术家。

definition.en: Relating to art (especially French painting) that came just before Impressionism and helped lead to it.
definition.zh: （尤指法国绘画）印象派之前的、为印象派铺垫的艺术风格或时期的。

examples.en: The museum has a small room of pre-Impressionist landscapes that show early experiments with light.
examples.zh: 博物馆有一间小展厅陈列印象派前期的风景画，能看出艺术家对光线的早期探索。

examples.en: She’s writing a paper on pre-Impressionist color choices in 19th-century France.
examples.zh: 她正在写一篇论文，研究19世纪法国印象派之前的用色选择。

definition.en: An artist whose work belongs to the period or style just before Impressionism.
definition.zh: 印象派之前时期/风格的艺术家；印象派前驱（艺术家）。

examples.en: Some critics describe Corot as a pre-Impressionist because of his attention to atmosphere.
examples.zh: 一些评论家认为柯罗可算印象派前驱，因为他很注重画面氛围。

examples.en: The lecture introduced several pre-Impressionists and explained how they influenced Monet and Renoir.
examples.zh: 讲座介绍了几位印象派前驱，并解释他们如何影响莫奈和雷诺阿。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”。“pre-Impressionist”常用在艺术史语境里，指19世纪中期一些画家与作品（如对光线、空气感与户外写生的探索）对后来的印象派产生了影响。它不是一个非常严格的固定流派名称，更像是“过渡阶段/先驱特征”的描述。
常见相关表达：proto-Impressionist（更强调“原型/先声”）、early Impressionist（指印象派内部的早期阶段，不同于pre-Impressionist）。

summary.en: Preimpressive means “before an impression is formed,” and it’s a rare, mostly academic adjective.
summary.zh: preimpressive 表示“在印象形成之前的”，是较罕见、偏学术用法的形容词。

definition.en: (Rare) Existing or happening before an impression is formed; before something makes its effect on the mind.
definition.zh: （罕见）在印象形成之前就存在的；在某事对人产生心理影响之前发生的。

examples.en: The researcher focused on preimpressive factors like prior knowledge and mood.
examples.zh: 研究者关注了先于印象形成的因素，比如已有知识和情绪。

examples.en: In this model, attention shapes the preimpressive stage before judgment.
examples.zh: 在这个模型中，注意力会塑造判断之前的“印象前阶段”。

extraExplanation: “preimpressive”在现代英语中非常少见，更多见于学术或技术语境（如心理学、认知科学）来表示“印象形成之前的阶段/条件”。日常表达更常用：before making an impression（在留下印象之前）、first impression（第一印象）、impression-forming（形成印象的）。
拼写上有时也会写成带连字符的“pre-impressive”。如果你的意思是“给人第一眼就很有好感/很吸引人”，更常用的词是“prepossessing”。

summary.en: “Preimprove” means to improve something ahead of time; it’s uncommon and informal, especially in technical contexts.
summary.zh: “preimprove”指“提前改进/预先优化”，不太常见，偏非正式，常见于技术语境。

definition.en: To improve something in advance (before a later step, event, or formal evaluation); a nonstandard/rare verb often used in technical or informal writing.
definition.zh: 提前改进（在后续步骤、事件或正式评估之前先做优化）；非标准/较少见的动词，多见于技术或非正式写作。

examples.en: We preimproved the code by removing obvious bugs before the full review.
examples.zh: 我们在正式评审前先把明显的漏洞修掉，对代码做了提前改进。

examples.en: The team wants to preimprove the onboarding guide so new hires struggle less on day one.
examples.zh: 团队想先把入职指南提前改进，让新人第一天少踩坑。

definition.en: To make preliminary enhancements or refinements (small, early improvements) to prepare something for a later, bigger improvement.
definition.zh: 做初步优化/小幅提前提升，为后续更大的改进做准备。

examples.en: Before redesigning the site, we preimproved the navigation labels to make them clearer.
examples.zh: 在重做网站前，我们先把导航标签优化得更清楚。

extraExplanation: “preimprove”不是常见标准词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-improve”，或直接用更自然的表达：“improve beforehand / make early improvements / do some preliminary improvements”。
在技术语境（如软件、流程优化）里，人们有时会造这种词来强调“在主要阶段之前先优化一轮”。正式写作中建议换成更常规的表达以避免读者困惑。

summary.en: Preimproved means ‘already improved in advance,’ often used in technical or promotional contexts.
summary.zh: preimproved 指“预先改进过的/事先已改善的”，多见于技术或宣传语境。

definition.en: improved beforehand; already improved before a later stage or event
definition.zh: 预先改良的；事先改进过的（在后续阶段或事件之前就已改善）

examples.en: They used preimproved seeds to increase the chance of a good harvest.
examples.zh: 他们使用预先改良的种子，以提高丰收的可能性。

examples.en: The app comes with preimproved privacy settings for new users.
examples.zh: 这款应用为新用户提供了预先优化过的隐私设置。

extraExplanation: “preimproved”不是非常常见的标准词，更多出现在技术说明、营销文案或临时造词中。它由前缀“pre-（预先）”+“improved（改进过的）”组成，强调“在某个时间点之前就已经改好了”。在更自然的表达里，常用“already improved”“previously improved”或“pre-optimized（预先优化的）/enhanced（增强过的）”。

summary.en: “Preimprovement” means the condition or value of something before improvements are made.
summary.zh: “Preimprovement”指某事物在进行改良/升级之前的状态或价值。

definition.en: The state, condition, or value of something before it is improved or upgraded (often used in real estate, accounting, or project documentation).
definition.zh: 改良/提升之前的状态、条件或价值（常见于房地产、会计或项目文件中）。

examples.en: The app’s preimprovement load time was nearly ten seconds.
examples.zh: 这个应用在优化前的加载时间接近10秒。

examples.en: The report compares preimprovement and postimprovement costs for the renovation.
examples.zh: 报告对比了翻新前（改良前）与翻新后（改良后）的成本。

examples.en: They estimated the building’s preimprovement market value for tax purposes.
examples.zh: 出于税务目的，他们估算了该建筑改良前的市场价值。

extraExplanation: “preimprovement”不是非常常见的标准词条，更常见的写法是加连字符的“pre-improvement”。在正式写作里，建议用“pre-improvement (condition/value/cost)”来让意思更清楚。
常见搭配：pre-improvement condition（改良前状况）, pre-improvement value（改良前价值）, pre-improvement costs（改良前成本）。
在房地产语境中，它常对应于“after-improved / post-improvement”的对比，用于评估改造、装修或土地改良带来的增值。

summary.en: “Preimproving” means making improvements in advance (rare/nonstandard; often written “pre-improving”).
summary.zh: “preimproving”指提前改进/预先优化（较少见、非标准用法，常写作“pre-improving”）。

definition.en: (Rare, informal) improving something beforehand, before a main event/process happens; making early improvements in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见、非正式）在主要事件/流程发生之前先进行改进；提前优化。

examples.en: We did some preimproving on the website so the launch would go smoothly.
examples.zh: 我们在上线前先对网站做了一些提前优化，确保发布顺利。

examples.en: The team spent a week preimproving the training materials before the new staff arrived.
examples.zh: 团队在新员工到来前花了一周时间提前改进培训材料。

extraExplanation:
“preimproving”不是常见标准词汇，更常见的写法是加连字符的“pre-improving”，或直接用更自然的表达：
- “improving in advance / ahead of time”（提前改进）
- “preemptively improving”（预先改进，以避免问题）
- “pre-launch improvements”（上线前的改进）
在正式写作中，通常建议改用以上更常见的说法，以免读者觉得生造或不清晰。

summary.en: Preinaugural means “before an inauguration,” especially before a new president officially takes office.
summary.zh: preinaugural 指“就职（典礼）之前的”，常用于总统就职等政治语境。

definition.en: Happening before an inauguration (the formal ceremony where someone begins an official job, especially a president).
definition.zh: 就职典礼前的；在（官员，尤指总统）宣誓就职仪式之前发生的。

examples.en: The president-elect attended a preinaugural briefing on national security.
examples.zh: 当选总统参加了一场就职前的国家安全简报会。

examples.en: Police increased patrols during the preinaugural week.
examples.zh: 在就职前一周，警方加强了巡逻。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“inaugural”来自“inauguration”（就职/就职典礼）。因此 preinaugural 常见于新闻与政治语境，尤其是美国总统就职相关报道中。
相关搭配：preinaugural events（就职前活动）、preinaugural address/speech（就职前讲话）、preinaugural period（就职前时期）。

summary.en: A rare verb meaning to inaugurate or start something ahead of its official beginning.
summary.zh: 一个较罕见的动词，指在正式开始之前就先行开幕/启用或提前启动。

definition.en: (rare) To inaugurate or introduce something before its official beginning; to begin or set in motion in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见）在正式开始之前为某事举行（或象征性地进行）就职/启用/开幕；提前启动、预先引入。

examples.en: The museum preinaugurated the exhibit with a small preview night for members.
examples.zh: 博物馆在正式开幕前为会员办了一场小型预览之夜，算是提前“启幕”。

examples.en: Some commentators say the speech preinaugurated the themes of the new administration.
examples.zh: 一些评论者说，这次演讲提前“预告并开启”了新政府的核心主题。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，常见写法通常是用更自然的表达来替代，比如：hold a pre-inauguration event（举办就职前活动）、launch early（提前发布/启动）、preview（预览/试运行）、usher in（开启……时代/阶段）。
构词上是 pre-（“在……之前”）+ inaugurate（“举行就职/开幕；开启”）。在政治语境里可指“就职前的预热/铺垫”，在一般语境里也可指“正式启用前的试运行或预览”。

summary.en: “Preinaugurated” means begun or completed before an official inauguration, especially in politics.
summary.zh: “preinaugurated”指在正式就职之前就已开始或已完成（尤用于政治语境）。

definition.en: (Formal) Completed or done before someone is officially inaugurated (formally begins a role, often a president or leader).
definition.zh: （正式用语）在某人正式就职（常指总统或领导人）之前就已完成或已发生的。

examples.en: The report was drafted in the preinaugurated period, before the new president took office.
examples.zh: 这份报告是在就职前的时期起草的，也就是新总统正式上任之前。

examples.en: Some policies were effectively preinaugurated through early announcements and staffing decisions.
examples.zh: 一些政策实际上通过提前的声明和人事安排而“先行启动”，发生在正式就职之前。

definition.en: Past participle of “preinaugurate”: to introduce, begin, or set in motion ahead of the official inauguration.
definition.zh: “preinaugurate”的过去分词：在正式就职之前引入、开启或推动（某事）。

examples.en: They had preinaugurated the new program with a small pilot project months earlier.
examples.zh: 他们在几个月前就用一个小型试点项目提前启动了这个新计划。

examples.en: A transition team preinaugurated several reforms through preliminary guidelines.
examples.zh: 过渡团队通过初步指导方针提前推动了几项改革。

extraExplanation: “preinaugurated”并不常见，更多出现在政治新闻或正式写作里，用来强调“在正式就职之前就已经开始/已经定下”。日常英语里更常用的说法是：before the inauguration / before taking office / in the transition period。
词形上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ inaugurate（使就职；使开始）。有时也会看到更自然的表达如 “pre-inauguration (period)”（就职前时期）。

summary.en: “Preinaugurating” means doing things before an official inauguration—preparing for it or (figuratively) setting the stage in advance.
summary.zh: “preinaugurating”指在正式就职/开幕之前进行的准备与铺垫；也可比喻为提前开启、预先打基础。

definition.en: (present participle of “preinaugurate”) happening or done before an official inauguration; preparing for or leading up to a formal “swearing-in” or opening ceremony.
definition.zh: （“preinaugurate”的现在分词）在正式就职/开幕典礼之前发生或进行；为正式就职/开幕做准备、铺垫。

examples.en: The team spent December preinaugurating the new administration with policy briefings and staff hires.
examples.zh: 团队在12月通过政策简报和招聘人员，为新政府的上任做前期准备。

examples.en: Security plans are often finalized while officials are preinaugurating the event.
examples.zh: 在活动就职/开幕前的筹备阶段，安保方案通常会定稿。

definition.en: (often figurative) introducing or setting something in motion ahead of its official start; laying the groundwork early.
definition.zh: （常为比喻）在正式开始前提前引入或启动；提前打基础、预先开启。

examples.en: The author’s first chapter is preinaugurating the themes that will dominate the novel.
examples.zh: 作者的第一章提前引出并铺垫了将主导整部小说的主题。

examples.en: A small pilot program can be preinaugurating a much larger reform.
examples.zh: 一个小规模试点可能是在为更大范围的改革提前开路。

extraExplanation: “preinaugurating”比较少见，更常见的表达是“pre-inauguration (events/period)”（就职前活动/时期）或“leading up to the inauguration”（临近就职典礼时）。
在美国政治语境里，它常可指总统当选到宣誓就职之间的“transition（过渡期）”里进行的任命、简报、政策准备等工作。

summary.en: “Preincarnate” means existing before becoming incarnate (in a body), often used in Christian theology for Christ before his birth as Jesus.
summary.zh: “preincarnate”指在获得肉身/化身为人之前就已存在，常用于基督教神学中指耶稣降生前的基督。

definition.en: Existing before becoming a person in a body; especially describing Christ’s existence before his birth as Jesus (in Christian theology).
definition.zh: （在化身为人之前）先存的；尤指基督在作为耶稣降生之前的存在（基督教神学用语）。

examples.en: Some Christians speak of the preincarnate Christ appearing in the Old Testament.
examples.zh: 一些基督徒认为“道成肉身之前的基督”曾在《旧约》中显现。

examples.en: The poem imagines a preincarnate soul watching the world from afar.
examples.zh: 这首诗想象一个“尚未转世/投生”的灵魂在远处注视世界。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少用于日常英语，更多见于神学、宗教研究或带有宗教意象的文学作品中。常见搭配是 the preincarnate Christ（道成肉身之前的基督）。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ incarnate（化身为人/具肉身的）。在基督教语境里，incarnation 指“道成肉身”，因此 preincarnate 常用于讨论“降生以前”的状态。

summary.en: A rare term meaning “before an incentive,” often written as pre-incentive.
summary.zh: 一个较少见的词，意思是“激励/奖励之前的（阶段或措施）”，常写作 pre-incentive。

definition.en: (Rare) Happening or provided before an incentive is offered; used to describe a period, condition, or communication that comes before the incentive.
definition.zh: （少见）在“激励/奖励”提供之前发生或给出的；用于描述激励之前的阶段、条件或沟通。

examples.en: The survey included a pre-incentive email explaining the purpose of the study.
examples.zh: 这份调查包含一封“激励前”的邮件，用来说明研究目的。

examples.en: They measured participants’ pre-incentive motivation before giving any rewards.
examples.zh: 他们在发放任何奖励之前，先测量了参与者的“激励前”动机。

definition.en: (Rare) A message, step, or condition that comes before an incentive and helps prepare people to respond to it.
definition.zh: （少见）激励措施之前的一段说明、步骤或条件，用来为后续激励做铺垫。

examples.en: The training session served as a pre-incentive to improve program participation.
examples.zh: 这次培训起到了“激励前置措施”的作用，用来提升项目参与度。

examples.en: Clear rules are an effective pre-incentive for bonus programs.
examples.zh: 明确的规则是奖金计划中有效的“激励前置环节”。

extraExplanation: “preincentive”更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-incentive”。在商业、市场营销、行为科学的文章里偶尔会出现，用来强调“激励之前”的阶段或干预。
如果你是写作想表达“激励之前的措施/沟通”，也可以考虑更常用的表达：“before the incentive,” “prior to the incentive,” “pre-reward,” “upfront communication/priming”（语境不同用法不同）。

summary.en: Preinclination means an existing tendency or preference you have in advance.
summary.zh: Preinclination 指你事先就有的倾向或偏好（带有先入为主的意味）。

definition.en: A tendency, preference, or bias that you already have before something happens or before you think carefully about it.
definition.zh: 在事情发生之前或在深入思考之前就已经存在的倾向、偏好或成见。

examples.en: She had a preinclination to distrust strangers because of past experiences.
examples.zh: 由于过去的经历，她先入为主地不太信任陌生人。

examples.en: Try to set aside your preinclinations and look at the evidence fairly.
examples.zh: 尽量放下先入为主的想法，公正地看待证据。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **preincination** 不是常见拼写；更常见、也更符合语义的词是 **preinclination**（在“inclination 倾向/偏好”前加 pre- 表示“事先/预先”）。
在写作里，**preinclination** 常用来表达“先入之见/预设立场”。如果你想表达更强的“偏见”，也可以用 **prejudice**；更中性的“既有偏好”可用 **predisposition**。

summary.en: A preexisting tendency or bias (predisposition).
summary.zh: 预先存在的倾向或偏见（预倾向）。

definition.en: An existing tendency, preference, or bias you have before something happens (a predisposition).
definition.zh: （事情发生前就有的）倾向、偏好或成见；预先的倾向（相当于 predisposition）。

examples.en: Her preinclination toward caution made her double-check every detail.
examples.zh: 她天生偏谨慎，所以会把每个细节都再三核对。

examples.en: Because of his preinclination to trust people, he often lends money too quickly.
examples.zh: 因为他本来就容易相信别人，所以常常借钱借得太快。

examples.en: Try to notice your preinclinations when you read the news.
examples.zh: 阅读新闻时，尽量觉察自己原本的倾向和立场。

extraExplanation: “preinclination”较少见，日常英语中更常用的是“predisposition / inclination / bias”。如果写正式文章，使用“predisposition”通常更自然。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ inclination（倾向），强调“在接触新信息或事件之前就已存在的倾向”。

summary.en: Preincline means to tilt something beforehand, or (more rarely) to be predisposed to a choice in advance.
summary.zh: Preincline 指“预先使……倾斜”，或（较少见）“事先倾向于某种选择/观点”。

definition.en: to tilt or lean something in advance; to set at a slight angle beforehand (often in technical or design contexts).
definition.zh: （常用于技术/设计语境）预先使……倾斜；提前设定……为一定角度。

examples.en: Before installation, the engineer preinclined the ramp to improve drainage.
examples.zh: 安装前，工程师先把坡道预先做成倾斜，以便排水。

examples.en: The camera mount was preinclined so the lens would point slightly downward.
examples.zh: 相机支架被预先设为倾斜，使镜头略微向下。

definition.en: to have a tendency or preference ahead of time; to be predisposed (rare in modern everyday English).
definition.zh: （较少见）预先倾向于；事先偏向于（某种选择/观点）。

examples.en: She was preinclined to trust the plan because it had worked before.
examples.zh: 因为以前奏效过，她一开始就倾向于相信这个方案。

examples.en: Many readers are preinclined to sympathize with the narrator.
examples.zh: 许多读者会先入为主地同情叙述者。

extraExplanation: “preincline”由前缀 pre-（预先）+ incline（倾斜/倾向）构成，属于较少使用的词，更常见的替代表达是 **incline beforehand**, **set at an angle**, 或表示心理倾向的 **be predisposed to** / **be inclined to**。
在写作中若不是技术说明文，使用 “preincline” 可能显得生硬或不自然；日常英语更偏好用短语来表达同样意思。

summary.en: “Preinclined” means predisposed in advance—already leaning toward an opinion or action before events unfold.
summary.zh: “preinclined”指在事情发生前就已经有倾向或偏好，即“预先倾向/先入为主”。

definition.en: Already inclined or disposed toward something before it happens; predisposed in advance.
definition.zh: 事先就倾向于某事的；预先有偏好的；先入为主的。

examples.en: She was preinclined to trust the new manager because a friend recommended him.
examples.zh: 因为朋友推荐过他，她事先就倾向于信任这位新经理。

examples.en: If you’re preinclined to dislike the movie, you may notice only its flaws.
examples.zh: 如果你事先就倾向于不喜欢这部电影，你可能只会注意到它的缺点。

examples.en: The judge reminded the jury not to be preinclined either way before hearing all the evidence.
examples.zh: 法官提醒陪审团在听完所有证据前不要先入为主。

extraExplanation: “preinclined”在现代英语中不算常用，更常见、更自然的表达是“predisposed (to)”“inclined (to)”或“already biased (toward/against)”。
构词上：pre-（在……之前）+ inclined（倾向的）。语气通常比“biased”更中性，强调“倾向/偏好”而不一定是“不公正”。

summary.en: “Preinclining” means biasing or predisposing someone in advance.
summary.zh: “preinclining”指在事前让人产生倾向或偏向。

definition.en: (present participle of “preincline”) causing someone to lean toward an idea or choice in advance; predisposing; biasing beforehand.
definition.zh: （“preincline”的现在分词）事先使某人倾向于某种想法或选择；预先诱导/使产生倾向；预先造成偏向。

examples.en: The headlines were preinclining readers to see the issue as a scandal.
examples.zh: 这些标题在事先让读者倾向于把这件事看作丑闻。

examples.en: His childhood experiences were preinclining him to distrust authority.
examples.zh: 他的童年经历让他更容易事先倾向于不信任权威。

definition.en: the act or process of predisposing or biasing in advance (used as a verb form in continuous tenses).
definition.zh: 预先使产生倾向/偏向的行为或过程（作为动词的进行时形式使用）。

examples.en: The teacher’s comment was preinclining the class toward one answer.
examples.zh: 老师的评论正在让全班提前偏向某一个答案。

extraExplanation: “preincline / preinclining”在现代英语中比较少见，常见且更自然的替代表达有：“predispose (to)”“bias”“prime (someone) (to)”或“incline (someone) toward”。在正式写作中用“preinclining”会显得更书面、更强调“在事情发生前就造成倾向”。

summary.en: “Preinclude” means to include something ahead of time, often in templates or technical setups.
summary.zh: “preinclude”表示“预先包含/事先纳入”，常见于模板或技术配置等语境。

definition.en: to include something in advance; to make it part of a list, group, or plan before a later stage
definition.zh: 预先包含；事先把某物列入/纳入（名单、范围或计划）

examples.en: The template preincludes the required safety warnings.
examples.zh: 这个模板会预先包含必需的安全警示。

examples.en: We preincluded your name on the guest list to save time at check-in.
examples.zh: 为了节省签到时间，我们已把你的名字预先加入宾客名单。

examples.en: If you preinclude the files, the installer won’t need to download them later.
examples.zh: 如果你预先包含这些文件，安装程序之后就不需要再下载了。

extraExplanation: “preinclude”在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的表达是 “include in advance / include beforehand / pre-load / pre-populate / build in”。在技术文档、模板、软件配置语境里更可能看到。
构词上是前缀 pre-（“预先”）+ include（“包含”）。有时会写作 “pre-include”。

summary.en: Preincluded means already included in advance.
summary.zh: preincluded 指“预先已包含在内”。

definition.en: already included beforehand; included in advance (often before a product is sold, installed, or delivered).
definition.zh: 预先包含的；事先已包含在内的（常指在销售、安装或交付之前就已经包含）。

examples.en: The kit comes with preincluded batteries, so you can use it right away.
examples.zh: 这套工具自带预先包含的电池，所以你可以马上使用。

examples.en: Shipping is preincluded in the total price.
examples.zh: 运费已预先包含在总价中。

extraExplanation: “preincluded”在实际写作中更常见的形式是带连字符的“pre-included”，尤其在正式或出版文本里更清晰。
它多用于产品说明、合同/报价、软件功能列表等语境；更口语的表达常用“already included / included in the price”。

summary.en: “Preincluding” means including something beforehand, mainly in formal contexts.
summary.zh: “preincluding”表示“预先包括/事先包含”，多用于正式语境。

definition.en: Including in advance; including beforehand (often used in formal or legal writing).
definition.zh: 预先包括；事先包含（常见于正式或法律文本）。

examples.en: The total cost is $500, preincluding taxes and service fees.
examples.zh: 总费用为500美元，已预先包括税费和服务费。

examples.en: The package price is fixed, preincluding delivery to your address.
examples.zh: 套餐价格固定，已预先包含送货上门费用。

definition.en: Present participle form meaning “to include beforehand,” describing an action of adding something into a group or list in advance (rare).
definition.zh: “预先纳入/事先包含”的现在分词形式，用来描述把某事先放进某个范围或清单里（较少见）。

examples.en: By preincluding the standard clauses, the contract becomes easier to review.
examples.zh: 通过预先纳入标准条款，合同更容易审核。

examples.en: The editor is preincluding a short glossary for new readers.
examples.zh: 编辑正在为新读者预先加入一份简短术语表。

extraExplanation: “preincluding”不是常见日常用词，更常见、更自然的表达是：included in advance / already included / including…。在广告或合同里，为避免歧义，有时会用“pre-included”或“price includes … (in advance)”来表达“已含/预先包含”。
如果你在写作中想表达“费用已含税”，更地道的写法包括：“tax included,” “including tax,” 或 “price includes tax.”

summary.en: Preinclusion means including something beforehand or in advance.
summary.zh: preinclusion 指“预先纳入、事先包含”。

definition.en: the act or practice of including something in advance; being included beforehand (often in planning, publishing, or research contexts)
definition.zh: 预先纳入；事先包含（常用于规划、出版或研究语境）

examples.en: The preinclusion of safety checks in the design process reduced later mistakes.
examples.zh: 在设计流程中预先纳入安全检查减少了后期错误。

examples.en: Researchers discussed the preinclusion of certain participants before the study officially began.
examples.zh: 研究人员在研究正式开始前讨论了是否要预先纳入某些参与者。

extraExplanation: “preinclusion”由前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ inclusion（纳入、包含）构成，但在日常英语里非常少见。更常见、更自然的表达是 “prior inclusion / early inclusion / including … in advance”。
在科研写作中，你更可能看到 “pre-inclusion criteria”（预先纳入标准）或 “pre-included” 这类搭配，用来强调某项内容在正式步骤开始前就已被纳入。

summary.en: “Preincorporate” means to incorporate something in advance, or to legally incorporate a company earlier than a planned step or deadline.
summary.zh: “preincorporate”指“预先纳入/提前并入”，也可指“在计划步骤或期限前提前注册成立公司”。

definition.en: to incorporate (something) in advance; to make something part of a whole before a later step or stage
definition.zh: 预先纳入；提前并入（在后续步骤之前先把某事物变成整体的一部分）

examples.en: The team preincorporated user feedback into the first prototype.
examples.zh: 团队把用户反馈预先纳入到第一版原型里。

examples.en: We preincorporate safety checks so problems are caught early.
examples.zh: 我们提前并入安全检查，以便尽早发现问题。

definition.en: to form or set up (a company or organization) before a particular event, deadline, or planned operation
definition.zh: 在某个事件/期限/计划行动之前先行注册成立（公司或组织）

examples.en: They decided to preincorporate the startup before signing the investment agreement.
examples.zh: 他们决定在签投资协议之前先把初创公司注册成立。

examples.en: Some founders preincorporate to open a business bank account early.
